page.title: 04Women's Institute.
page.content: {WOMENS INSTITUTE The WI started in Canada then spread to Wales.By 1915 the movement started in England.It now has 350,000 members. Boxted WI meets every second Tuesday of the month at the village hall. There are 45 members, some of whom serve on the local committee. The Head Office is in London.Each month there is a visiting speaker and a competition of a domestic nature. Talks include flower arranging, cake making, bird watching, health, butterflies, history and a vets life. Each month a magazine comes out "Home and Country"! price 32p.Courses are held in their own special college,Denman College,Abingdon,Oxon. It is residential and women travel from all over the country to attend courses on community life.
